question: Sappho lived and wrote her poems over 2,500 years ago.
The word 'lesbian' comes from the name of Sappho’s home island, Lesbos.
Sappho’s poetry was originally meant to be read silently, like modern poems.
Sappho was one of the first poets to write about abstract feelings and emotions.
Sappho's voice feels surprisingly modern, even though her poems were written millennia ago.
